message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <object name> PLACE <location>
2) WAIT
Only PICK an object if your gripper is empty. Target <location> for PLACE should be panel.
[Action Output Instruction]
Think step-by-step about your plan and output your idea, and then output 'EXECUTE
', then give **exactly** one action per robot, put each on a new line.
Example 1: Hello Bob and Chad,I think we should execute the following actions:
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK red_square PLACE panel3
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
NAME Chad ACTION PICK green_trapezoid PLACE panel6

Example 2: Hello Alice and Bob, I am Chad. I can help with moving the blue_square from panel7 to panel3 so that Alice can reach it.
EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
NAME Chad ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel3


[Previous Round History]
== Previous Round# ==
[Chat History]
[Alice]:
Since the blue_square is currently on panel5, which is out of my reach, I will need Bob's help to move it closer to me. Bob can pick up the blue_square and place it on panel3, which is within my reach. Meanwhile, I can wait as there is no action I can take that would progress our task. Chad should also wait since the yellow_trapezoid is already on panel3 and he cannot reach it to move it to its final destination yet.

EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel3
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Alice's plan is 7.639!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Executed Action]
Alice: WAIT
Bob: PICK blue_square PLACE panel3
Chad: WAIT
== Current Round ==

[Current Rounde Previous Chat]
[Alice]:
Since the blue_square is now on panel3, I can pick it up and place it on panel2, which is its target panel. Bob can pick up the yellow_trapezoid from panel3 and place it on panel6, which is within his reach and also the target panel for the yellow_trapezoid. Chad should wait because he cannot reach any cubes at the moment.

EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel2
NAME Bob ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel6
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Alice's plan is 6.248!
The advantage score is high enough.
[Alice]:
The previous plan failed because Bob was instructed to pick up the yellow_trapezoid which is out of his reach on panel3. To correct this, I, Alice, can pick up the blue_square from panel3 and place it on its target panel2. Bob should pick up the pink_polygon from panel4 and place it on the same panel, as it is already in the correct location. Chad can now pick up the yellow_trapezoid from panel3 and place it on its target panel6.

EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel2
NAME Bob ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
NAME Chad ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel6
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Alice's plan is 2.449!
The advantage score is high enough.

7 panels on the table, ordered left to right: panel1,...,panel7. They form a straight assembly line, panel1 is closed to panel2 and farthest from panel7.
There are 3 cubes, each robot must place their cube on the correct target, their (cube, target_panel) pairs: 
Alice: (blue_square, panel2), 
Bob: (pink_polygon, panel4), 
Chad: (yellow_trapezoid, panel6).
There are 3 robots, each with a limited reach range, this means they can only pick cubes from these panels, and can only place cubes on these panels. The (robot, [reachable_panels]) pairs: 
(Alice, [panel1, panel2, panel3])
(Bob, [panel3, panel4, panel5])
(Chad, [panel5, panel6, panel7])

At the current round:
[Scene description]
blue_square is on panel3
pink_polygon is in panel4
yellow_trapezoid is on panel3
Alice's gripper is empty, can reach cubes: blue_square, yellow_trapezoid, can't reach cubes: pink_polygon, 
Bob's gripper is empty, can reach cubes: blue_square, pink_polygon, yellow_trapezoid, 
Chad's gripper is empty,can't reach cubes: blue_square, pink_polygon, yellow_trapezoid,.

Robot Alice, Bob and Chad need collaborate to put all cube to correct target panel as quickly as possible.
Please output the actions most suitable for robots to complete this task.
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].
Respond very concisely but informatively.
If one robot's cube is out of its reach, ask others for help.
Each response of you will get an advantage score. If the score exceeds the given number, the answer will be considered as helpful to the completion of this task. 
The higher the advantage score, the greater the contribution.You can find the advantage score information in [Evaluation Score].
If [Improve Feedback] exists, please revise the plan according to the information provided by it to better complete this task! 
Propose exactly one action for yourself at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response by either: 1) If everyone has made proposals and got approved, output the final plan, must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!
            
[Environment Feedback]:
- Previous Plan:
NAME Alice ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel2
NAME Bob ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel6
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
- Goal Step Alice (-0.80, 0.50, 0.50); Bob (0.80, 0.50, 0.50); Chad (1.39, 1.18, 0.44):
   - Reachability failed: Out of reach: Bob (0.80, 0.50, 0.50); 
  
[Environment Feedback]:
- Previous Plan:
NAME Alice ACTION PICK blue_square PLACE panel2
NAME Bob ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
NAME Chad ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel6
- Goal Step Alice (-0.51, 0.40, 0.29); Bob (-0.00, 0.50, 0.32); Chad (-0.30, 0.60, 0.29):
   - Reachability failed: Out of reach: Chad (-0.30, 0.60, 0.29); 
  
[Current Chat]
[Alice]:
Since Chad cannot reach the yellow_trapezoid on panel3, I will pick it up and place it on panel2, which is within my reach. Bob should pick up the pink_polygon from panel4 and place it back on panel4, as it is already in the correct location. Chad should wait because he still cannot reach any cubes at the moment.

EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel2
NAME Bob ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
[Evaluation Score]:
The advantage score of Alice's plan is -1.896!
The score is low and the plan need to be changed!

[Improve Feedback]

Bob should pick up the pink_polygon from panel4 and place it back on panel4, as it is already in the correct location. Chad should wait because he still cannot reach any cubes at the moment.

EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION PICK yellow_trapezoid PLACE panel2
NAME Bob ACTION PICK pink_polygon PLACE panel4
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
The advantage score score is -1.896, it is too low to run, the answer may contain a misunderstanding of the state of the environment, you must change your action to raise the advantage score over -0.7!
You are Bob, your response is:

I understand that my previous action was not optimal. To correct this, I will pick up the blue_square from panel3 and place it on panel2, which is within my reach and is the target panel for the blue_square. This will allow Alice to later move the yellow_trapezoid to its correct position. Chad should continue to wait as he still cannot reach any cubes.
